org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.core

Class RMCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.core.RMCore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.objectweb.proactive.Active, org.objectweb.proactive.InitActive, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive, ServiceUsingPermission, ResourceManager

    public class RMCore
extends Object
implements ResourceManager, org.objectweb.proactive.InitActive, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive
    The main active object of the Resource Manager (RM), the RMCore has to provide nodes to clients.

    The RMCore functions are:

    • Create Resource Manager's active objects at its initialization
    • Keep an up-to-date list of nodes able to perform scheduler's tasks.
    • Give nodes to the Scheduler asked by RMProxyUserInterface object, with a node selection mechanism performed by SelectionScript.
    • Dialog with node sources which add and remove nodes to the Core.
    • Perform creation and removal of NodeSource objects.
    • Treat removing nodes and adding nodes requests
    • Create and launch RMEvents concerning nodes and nodes sources to RMMonitoring active object.

    Nodes in Resource Manager are represented by objects. RMcore has to manage different states of nodes:

    • Free: node is ready to perform a task.
    • Busy: node is executing a task.
    • To be removed: node is busy and have to be removed at the end of the its current task.
    • Down: node is broken, and not anymore able to perform tasks.

    RMCore is not responsible of creation, acquisition and monitoring of nodes, these points are performed by NodeSource objects.

    WARNING: you must instantiate this class as an Active Object!

    RmCore should be non-blocking which means:

    • No direct access to nodes.
    • All method calls to other active objects should be either asynchronous or non-blocking immediate services.
    • Methods which have to return something depending on another active objects should use an automatic continuation.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9

      • internalRegisterConfiguringNode

        public void internalRegisterConfiguringNode(RMNode rmnode)
        Internal operation of configuring a node. The node is not useable by a final user ( not eligible thanks to getNode methods ) if it is in configuration state. This method is called by RMNodeConfigurator to notify the core that the process of configuring the rmnode has started. The end of the process will be notified thanks to the method internalAddNodeToCore(RMNode)
        Parameters:
        rmnode - the node in the configuration state

      • setNodesAvailable

        public Set<String> setNodesAvailable(Set<String> nodeUrls)
        This method is called periodically by ProActive Nodes to inform the Resource Manager of a possible reconnection. The method is also used by ProActive Nodes to know if they are still known by the Resource Manager. For instance a Node which has been removed by a user from the Resource Manager is no longer known.

        The method is defined as Immediate Service. This way it is executed in a dedicated Thread. It is essential in order to allow other methods to be executed immediately even if incoming connection to the Nodes is stopped or filtered while a timeout occurs when this method tries to send back a reply.

        The allNodes data-structure is written by a single Thread only but read by multiple Threads.

        Parallel executions of this method must involves different nodeUrls.

        The underlying calls to setBusyNode and internalSetFree are writing to the freeNodes data-structure. It explains why this last is synchronized (thread-safe).

        Specified by:
        setNodesAvailable in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nodeUrls - the URLs of the workers associated to the node that publishes the update.
        Returns:
        The set of worker node URLs that are unknown to the Resource Manager (i.e. have been removed by a user).

      • getNodeState

        public NodeState getNodeState(String nodeUrl)

      • defineNodeSource

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper defineNodeSource(String nodeSourceName,

                                                                                 Object[] policyParams,
                                                                                 boolean nodesRecoverable)

        defineNodeSource in interface ResourceManager

        infraParams - parameters for infrastructure creation

        nodesRecoverable - whether the nodes can be recovered in case of a scheduler crash

      • createNodeSource

        @Deprecated
public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper createNodeSource(String nodeSourceName,
                                                                                             String infrastructureType,
                                                                                             Object[] infrastructureParameters,
                                                                                             String policyType,
                                                                                             Object[] policyParameters,
                                                                                             boolean nodesRecoverable)
        Deprecated. As of version 8.1, replaced by defineNodeSource(String, String, Object[], String, Object[], boolean) and deployNodeSource(String)
        Specified by:
        createNodeSource in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nodeSourceName - the name of the node source
        infrastructureType - type of the underlying infrastructure
        infrastructureParameters - parameters for infrastructure creation
        policyType - name of the policy type. It passed as a string due to plug-able approach
        policyParameters - parameters for policy creation
        nodesRecoverable - whether the nodes can be recovered in case of a scheduler crash
        Returns:
        true if a new node source was created successfully, runtime exception otherwise

      • deployNodeSource

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper deployNodeSource(String nodeSourceName)
        Start acquiring the nodes of a node source that has been defined before. If the node source is already deployed, then this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        deployNodeSource in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nodeSourceName - the name of the node source to deploy
        Returns:
        true if the node source was deployed successfully, false if the node source is already deployed, runtime exception otherwise

      • recoverNodeSource

        public void recoverNodeSource(NodeSourceDescriptor nodeSourceDescriptor)
        Recreate a node source from a node source descriptor and deploy it if the node source descriptor specifies a deployed status. The flow is inspired from defineNodeSource(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object[], java.lang.String, java.lang.Object[], boolean) and deployNodeSource(java.lang.String) but this version does not emit events as the recovered node sources are supposed to have been created and deployed already in the past.
        Parameters:
        nodeSourceDescriptor - the descriptor of the node source to recover

      • undeployNodeSource

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper undeployNodeSource(String nodeSourceName,
                                                                                   boolean preempt)
        Remove the nodes of a node source that has been deployed before, and keep the node source defined in the resource manager. If the node source is already undeployed, then this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        undeployNodeSource in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nodeSourceName - the name of the node source to undeploy
        preempt - if true remove the nodes immediately without waiting them to be freed.
        Returns:
        true if the node source was undeployed successfully, false if the node source is already undeployed, runtime exception otherwise

      • releaseNode

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper releaseNode(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
        Releases the node after computations. The specified node is marked as free and become available to other users.
        Specified by:
        releaseNode in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be released
        Returns:
        true if the node has been released successfully, runtime exception otherwise. SecurityException may be thrown if the user does not have right to release the node or it tries to release a foreign node.

      • releaseNodes

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper releaseNodes(NodeSet nodes)

        Specified by:
        releaseNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nodes - the set of nodes to be released
        Returns:
        true if nodes have been released successfully, runtime exception otherwise. SecurityException may be thrown if the user does not have right to release one of nodes or it tries to release a foreign node.

      • getAtMostNodes

        public NodeSet getAtMostNodes(int nbNodes,
                              SelectionScript selectionScript)
        Finds "number" nodes for computations according to the selection script. All nodes which are returned to the client as marked internally as busy and cannot be used by others until the client frees them.

        If the resource manager does not have enough nodes it returns as much as it has, but only those which correspond to the selection criteria.

        Specified by:
        getAtMostNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        nbNodes - the number of nodes
        selectionScript - criterion to be verified by the returned nodes
        Returns:
        a list of nodes

      • getAtMostNodes

        public NodeSet getAtMostNodes(int number,
                              SelectionScript selectionScript,
                              NodeSet exclusion)
        Finds "number" nodes for computations according to the selection script. All nodes which are returned to the client as marked internally as busy and cannot be used by others until the client frees them.

        If the resource manager does not have enough nodes it returns as much as it has, but only those which correspond the to selection criteria.

        Specified by:
        getAtMostNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        number - the number of nodes
        selectionScript - criterion to be verified by the returned nodes
        exclusion - a list of node which should not be in the result set
        Returns:
        a list of nodes

                              List<SelectionScript> scripts,
                              NodeSet exclusion)

        a list of nodes

        Finds "number" nodes for computations according to the selection scripts (node must be complaint to all scripts). All nodes which are returned to the client as marked internally as busy and cannot be used by others until the client frees them.

      • getDbManager

      • getNodes

        public NodeSet getNodes(int number,
                        TopologyDescriptor topology,
                        List<SelectionScript> selectionScrips,
                        NodeSet exclusion,
                        boolean bestEffort)
        Finds "number" nodes for computations according to the selection scripts (node must be complaint to all scripts). All nodes which are returned to the client as marked internally as busy and cannot be used by others until the client frees them.

        If the resource manager does not have enough nodes the result depends on the bestEffort mode. If set to true, the method returns as many node as it has, but only those which correspond the to selection criteria. If bestEffort set to false the method returns either 0 or all required nodes.

        Specified by:
        getNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        number - the number of nodes
        topology - the topology descriptor of nodes
        selectionScrips - criteria to be verified by the returned nodes
        exclusion - a list of node which should not be in the result set
        bestEffort - the mode of node aggregation
        Returns:
        a list of nodes
        See Also:
        TopologyDescriptor

      • getNodes

        public NodeSet getNodes(Criteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Finds and books nodes for computations. Nodes should satisfy specified criteria.
        Specified by:
        getNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        criteria - criteria to select nodes
        Returns:
        a list of nodes according to the criteria
        See Also:
        Criteria

      • getExactlyNodes

        public NodeSet getExactlyNodes(int nb,
                               SelectionScript selectionScript)

      • getRMInitialState

        public RMInitialState getRMInitialState()
        Builds and returns a snapshot of RMCore's current state. Initial state must be understood as a new Monitor point of view. A new monitor start to receive RMCore events, so must be informed of the current state of the Core at the beginning of monitoring. The monitor is built in three parts first with all the nodes knows by the RMCore, then with all deploying nodes known by the deployed node sources and then with all the defined node sources.
        Returns:
        RMInitialState containing nodes and nodeSources of the RMCore.

      • lockNodes

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper lockNodes(Set<String> urls)
        Locks the set of nodes and makes them not available for others. The node state "locked" means that node cannot be used for computations by anyone. Could be called only by node administrator, which is one of the following: rm admin, node source admin or node provider. Nodes can be locked whatever their state is.
        Specified by:
        lockNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        urls - is a set of nodes
        Returns:
        true if all the nodes become locked, false otherwise.

        public org.objectweb.proactive.core.util.wrapper.BooleanWrapper unlockNodes(Set<String> urls)
        Unlock nodes. The specified nodes become available to other users for computations. Real eligibility still depends on the Node state. Could be called only by node administrator, which is one of the following: rm admin, node source admin or node provider.
        Specified by:
        unlockNodes in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        urls - is a set of nodes to be unlocked.
        Returns:
        true if all the nodes are unlocked with success, false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        nodeSourceName - the node source name
        provider - if false, the method will check if the user is admin, if true, the method will also check if the node is a provider
        Returns:
        true if the user has permission to access the nodeSource, false otherwise
        See Also:
        ResourceManager.checkNodeSourcePermission(String, boolean)
